body.name: [Netflix Officially-Licensed] Projector with 5G WiFi and Bluetooth, DBPOWER Native 1080p Movie Projector Built-in Netflix, 500ANSI Portable Smart Projector 4K with Dolby Audio for Outdoor Home Theater
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 14 hrs 39 mins
features: 【Netflix Officially Licensed】DBPOWER Smart projector stands out for its officially licensed by Netflix and seamless integration with Smart TV OS. No need to buy TV sticks, instant access to most popular streaming built-in Apps- Netflix, YouTube, Prime Video, Disney+, Hulu, YouTube Kids, ToonGoggles,TikiLIVE, Docubay, and MetaxTV. Also, the Netflix projector regularly updates the above Apps to the latest version giving you access to the latest features and improving app security and stability.

【Native 1080P/ Ture 500 ANSI】DBPOWER movie projector brings movies and shows to life in Full HD 1920 x 1080 native resolution and true 500 ANSI Lumen brightness in a dark environment. The video projector 4k adopts the newest LTPS 4.5"LCD imaging technology to project from a 40"- 200" large screen. The Zoom allows you to easily adjust the image size from 100% to 50% without moving the mini projector. The 4P Keystone correction achieves screen adaptions with a wide angle of ±45°from 4 directions.

【5G/2.4G Dual-Band WiFi】5G WiFi bluetooth projector boasts 5G/2.4G dual-band WiFi tech capable of receiving a WiFi signal on 2 frequencies at the same time, allows more flexibility and bandwidth to transmit smoother and speed faster. The phone projector with WiFi allows you wireless mirror or cast content from your compatible iOS iPhone with Airplay, Android Phone and Win10 laptop with Miracast to a giant projector screen. WiFi projectors will provide you with an immersive cinematic experience.

【Bluetooth 5.2/Dolby Audio】G01 Projector with wifi and bluetooth supports two-way Bluetooth 5.2 audio transmission, either can be connected mobile device to be used as a standalone stereo speaker, or paired with external Bluetooth speaker/headphone/soundbar to enhance audio effects for home projectors anytime and anywhere. The home theater projector with Dolby Audio supports 360°stereo surround sound for immersive cinema-like fun. Bluetooth projectors only supports audio NOT video transmission.

【Wide Connectivity/Portable Bag】DBPOWER small projector features wide connectivity enabled by 1*HDMI, 1*AV, 2*USB ports, and 1*3.5mm headphone jack. The portable projector is compatible with Game boxes, TV sticks, PCs, DVD players, USB flash drives, laptops, and phones. The outdoor projector comes with a 1* IR remote( 2 AAA batteries not included), an HDMI cable, an AV cable, a power cable, a lens cover, and a portable bag. The ceiling projector supports the front/back/ceiling mount.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Want a smart projector that’s built for a great Netflix experience?
DBPOWER G01 Netflix Official Licensed Smart Projector with 5G WiFi & Bluetooth Previous page Next page
G01 Video Projector Built-in Netflix, Prime Video, YouTube, Hulu and Disney+ App Previous page Next page
DBPOWER 5G WiFi Bluetooth Projector with Dolby Audio & HiFi Speaker for Outdoor Previous page Next page
DBPOWER Native 1080p Projector, 500 ANSI Brightness, Advanced MTK Chip, 8x Lens Previous page Next page

What apps does the smart projector with wifi and Bluetooth support? Such Netflix, Hulu, Disney+, Prime Video, HBO Max? G01 projector built-in Netflix, YouTube, Prime Video, Disney+, Hulu, YouTube Kids, ToonGoggles, TikiLIVE, Docubay, and MetaxTV. Can directly watch copyrighted content from the apps without buying a TV stick. But HBO Max & YouTube TV can NOT watched! Can I download any APP directly from the APP store of the projector? Is the APP store like the Google Play Store? No, you can't. The Netflix-licensed projector is not an Android TV projector. Only some officially licensed apps are available for downloading or watching. Please refer to the Product Description for the 4k projector support App type. How to screen mirror with iOS devices(iPhone/iPad) on the phone projector screen? 1. Please ensure your iOS device and projector are on the same Wi-Fi network. 2. Go to the projector homepage - [My Apps]- [APP Assistant]- [ScreenShare]. 3. Go to your iOS device - [Control Center] - [Screen Mirroring] - Select named G01 projector. How to watch Disney+ and Hulu on the movie projector with wifi and Bluetooth? 1. Go to the TV projector homepage - [My Apps]- [APP Assistant]- Download Disney+ or Hulu. 2. Then log in to your corresponding Disney+ and Hulu to watch. 3. HBO Max, Apple TV, Paramount+, etc. do NOT directly be watched on projectors. We strongly advise you to always know these details before purchasing the projector 4K with Netflix! 1. G01 projector ONLY supports officially licensed APPs or file types. 2. G01 projector in a dark environment gives a better viewing experience. 3. The remote control needs 2 AAA batteries to start. 4. Not recommended for TXT, PPT, Excel, Word.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This projector is a fantastic piece of technology that offers a remarkable viewing experience. With its 1080p native resolution, it delivers stunningly clear and sharp images. What's even more impressive is its ability to support and play 4K content seamlessly, without any issues. This projector truly brings your favorite movies, TV shows, and games to life with exceptional clarity and detail.The built-in Dolby Audio decoder ensures that the sound quality matches the visual excellence. The projector's speaker is surprisingly loud and produces good sound, although for the best audio experience, I highly recommend connecting a good soundbar system. This will truly elevate your home theater setup to the next level, immersing you in a world of captivating audiovisuals.Another standout feature of this projector is its full Android OS, which comes preloaded with a variety of media streaming apps. Additionally, you have the freedom to download and install any other apps available from the Play Store. This versatility allows you to access and enjoy a wide range of content and entertainment options, making this projector a complete multimedia solution.In terms of usability, this projector excels. It is lightweight, making it easy to mount on the ceiling or use as a tabletop projector. The setup process is hassle-free, and you can quickly adjust the projection angle to achieve the perfect viewing position. Whether you're looking to create a dedicated home theater or enjoy a movie night in any room, this projector offers convenience and flexibility.The video and image quality is also truly impressive. With its bright, sharp, and clear visuals, it delivers a theater-like experience in the comfort of your own home. Whether you're watching movies, playing games, or displaying presentations, this projector ensures that every detail is captured with precision and vibrancy.In conclusion, this DBpower HD projector is an excellent choice for those seeking a budget-friendly home projector without compromising on quality. Its 1080p native resolution, support for 4K content, built-in Dolby Audio decoder, and versatile Android OS make it a versatile and feature-rich option. With its lightweight design and exceptional video/image quality, this projector is a fantastic addition to any home entertainment setup.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is THE PROJECTOR! Full Stop. Great Picture Quality, Easy Set-up, Netflix Licensed
reviews.reviewText: This is one great projector! Very compact in size but jam-packed with features! It's fully licensed by Netflix and offers 5G Wi-Fi capability as well as HDMI input, USB, RCA cable input, and meshes seamlessly with your Smart TV Operating System and/or gaming system. The projector even updates apps like Prime Video, Netflix and others, so you can be sure you're running the latest version! The built-in apps include Netflix, YouTube, Prime Video, Disney+, Hulu, YouTube Kids, ToonGoggles, TikiLIVE, Docubay, and MetaxTV. The projector provides full 4K, 1080p quality, 500 ANSI brightness projection, Dolby sound, a headphone jack and....! All that plus incredible quality picture and sound, and more, in a portable projector with it's own handy carrying case! You also get a great remote control and the cables needed for hookup. Set up is a breeze! You'll be up in running in minutes! If you need an excellent state-of-the-art projector, look no further, this is THE PROJECTOR! and it comes at an excellent low price point!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The DBPOWER Netflix Projector Experience
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. So, let me set the scene: I've just unboxed the DBPOWER Netflix projector, and I'm buzzing with excitement to get this bad boy up and running. Spoiler alert: it's a cinematic masterpiece in a box.Cracking open the box was like early Christmas. Everything was snugly packed with soft foam – talk about VIP treatment for a projector! The sleek carrying case was a cherry on top, not just fitting the projector but all its cool gadgets too – HDMI cable, power cable, a handy remote, and more. It felt like unpacking a treasure chest.The projector itself? A beauty. It's got this modern vibe with its black and silver finish that just screams 'classy'. Setting it up was a breeze. Screw on the foot, pop it on a table, and voila, my living room's now a mini cinema.The setup was a walk in the park. A few clicks here and there – choosing projection mode, language, and Wi-Fi setup – and I'm at the "enjoying" part. Yeah, the message could use a tweak, but the sentiment? Spot on.Now, let's talk about why we're all here – the picture. It's like butter on popcorn. It's crisp, the colors pop like fireworks, and the blacks? Deep as the night sky. Adjusting the picture to fit my screen was no sweat with the 4 corner keystone and zoom. And the built-in apps? Netflix has never looked so good.The main draw for me was the built-in apps. No external devices needed, just me, my remote, and a world of streaming at my fingertips. And yeah, while not every app under the sun is there, the browser is your golden ticket to anywhere you miss.I had a tiny hiccup – a bug decided to photobomb my movie night and got into the projector. A quick shoutout to DBPOWER's customer service, and boom, problem solved. They guided me through a simple cleaning fix, complete with a YouTube tutorial. MVPs, right there.In a nutshell, this projector is the real deal. It's got the looks, the brains, and the brawn to turn any room into your own private theater. Whether it's movie marathons, binge-watching, or gaming, this projector's got you covered. DBPOWER, you've outdone yourselves.So, if you're in the market for a projector that's a breeze to use, delivers stunning visuals, and comes with a side of excellent customer service, the DBPOWER Netflix projector should be at the top of your list. Trust me, your couch will thank you.If you want all the details, read on.What's in the box:The projector comes packed very secure within the box with soft foam that protects it from any bumps or bruises in shipping. The box itself is labeled with the specs and company information. The projector comes with a handy and very nice looking carrying case that has room for not just the projector, but also all of the accessories that come with it. The accessories include a user manual, a screw on foot for the bottom of the projector that allows it to be propped up at an angle if necessary, the remote control, a power cable, an RCA to 3.5mm jack input cable, and an HDMI cable. The remote has a simple layout that is intuitive with a power and input buttons, a directional circle with a select button labeled as "OK", back, menu and home buttons, as well as app launch buttons for Netflix, Youtube, Prime Video and a built in web browser.Projector layout:After installing the prop foot on the bottom of the projector, I inspected the how it was laid out and designed. Overall projector itself has a very sleek look mixing black and silvery gray.The front of the projector is very simple and has the lens on the left, which can be covered by an unobtrusive cap to protect it when not in use, and an IR receiver for the remote on the right hand side.The top of the projector has control buttons that include power, menu, select, back and navigational arrows. These are all that are needed to make full use of the projector and always are a MUST in my book for any projector. The top is also home to a manual focus that is easy to use and has smooth action. There is also a manual keystone wheel, but this does not seem to actually move. I suspect that it is either present for a situation where the 4 corner keystone is not sufficient, or is a relic from an older model projector that used the same basic design.The back of the projector has a grille for the built in speaker, and another grille for what I suspect is an air intake vent. The vent can be opened, and the grille cleaned, but does not provide access to the projector internals. Also, on the back is another IR receiver for the remote on the left hand side.The flat side of the projector has the heat exhaust vent along with the input and output ports, including a headphone output jack, the AV input jack for the RCA adapter, two USB ports and an HDMI port.On the bottom of the projector there are four rubber feet and a screw hole for the prop foot. Note that the rubber feet have mounting holes underneath them that allow the projector to be connected to a ceiling mount. Another thing to know is that underneath the center sticker is an access panel that allows access to the LCD and internal fresnel lens. This is rarely necessary, but if there is debris on the LCD, it can be removed using this panel and a cotton swab.The rounded side of the projector has only the power input and a removable vent.Initial Setup & Menu options:With the physical inspection complete, I plugged it in to my home theater and fired it up. I was greeted with a quick splash screen and a simple setup walkthrough. It first has you select which type of projection mode you want to use, offering standard front projection for the projector sitting on a table or some other flat surface, inverted ceiling mount projection, and rear projection options for both of these. I stuck with the standard projection since I was not mounting this in my theater as I plan to keep this one portable. Next you select your language, followed by region, then have a few notices to accept. You can quickly accept all of them, or view details to select only the ones that you want. This is followed by Wifi setup, then an option to sign in to Netflix, which I suppose is to be expected from a Netflix projector. Finally, setup is complete, and although the message has poor translation, the sentiment is nice. The message is "The setup is completed, enjoying!", but should probably be changed to "Setup is complete, enjoy!". Since the projector is able to have it's software updated, this could be changed in future versions of the projector or in an update for other projectors.After the guided setup, I had to make some adjustments to the zoom and 4 corner keystone to configure the picture to my screen. I have a 150 inch 4:3 screen, and had the projector sitting about 15 feet or so away (that is a total guess, as I did not measure it), so I reduced the size to get it to fit, and then scooted the corners around to line them up correctly. To adjust the corners, you cycle through them with the OK button. The currently selected corner has the dot on the rectangle in the image filled in, while the other three are empty. You then use the direction buttons on the remote to move the selected corner to the correct alignment. This was really easy to use and resulted in fantastic alignment and a great picture.Next, I checked out all of the menu options. There is one for setup, picture mode, audio, bluetooth, network, projection, keystone, zoom, and an "about".The "Setup" menu allows you to change the language, set the time, change the screen saver options, set a sleep timer, set the projector to sleep automatically, upgrade the software from a USB drive, check for updates over the internet, or to reset everything back to the defaults. I did run the software update, but the projector already had the latest software.The Picture Mode menu allows you to select some preset picture modes or to manually set values for brightness, contrast, saturation, hue, sharpness, gamma, and color temperature.The Audio menu lets you adjust the bass and treble or select a preset audio profile. This is not really handy for the tiny built in speaker, but might be for a bluetooth speaker or headphones. You can also set the digital output mode of the audio from the apps, and turn on dialogue enhancement. There is another option called TTS, which stands for Text To Speech, which is useful for navigating for visually impaired people.The Bluetooth menu is very straight forward and allows you to pair a bluetooth speaker or headphones. It might allow you to pair other devices too, but I did not try.the Wifi menu is also very simple and does exactly what you would expect.The Zoom and Keystone menu options let you access those features, which I already discussed.The About menu lets you access various device information, but also tells the device temperature.Video tests:After mucking around with the menu, I ran the projector through some standard video tests. There are some fantastic ones on YouTube that I regularly use. To view these, I used the preinstalled built in app. The first that I ran is an audio sync test. This has a bouncing ball and rotating pie and makes a beep in sync with the ball bouncing. Ideally, these are in sync, and with this projector and the built in speaker, it was perfectly in sync.Next, I launched a picture test video that has many tests built into a single view. A grid and circles allow you check that the keystone is correct, the color dots allow you to check the pure RGB colors. A color gradient lets you see if the color transitions are smooth. Squares transitioning from white to black through various shades of gray let you check the black levels. Parallel white bars that change size and distance to each other allow you to see the detail and sharpness of the projector and to check how much the white bleeds across pixels. Overall, the picture test looked very nice on this little projector!Next I played some high resolution, high color videos that come up when you search for "video test". These usually have some amazing looking video and I was not looking for anything specific with these, but rather just looking to make sure that the did in fact look great on this projector. Of course they did look fantastic and I wasted an hour watching random things. :)I wrapped this up by watching The Great Gatsby on Blue-ray. This film has some amazing photography that is very vibrant and is a good choice for testing out a projector and this one made it look fantastic.Built in apps:One of the main draws of this projector is the fact that it has built in apps and does not require an external device like a Fire Stick to watch Netflix, Prime Video and some other streaming services. In addition to the streaming apps, this also has an app store that has some games and other streaming apps. Not every video streaming app that US customers expect is available here, but there is a built in browser that allows access to any of these that support browser streaming.One thing to note is that the menu option on the far right of the bottom row that has four white squares in it provides a way to install Hulu and Disney+. Please see my video that shows how this works.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Really nice projector!!
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Very impressed with this projector the image quality is great! Looks way better in person than it does in the video recording I did. The price is reasonable! The sound is great quality as well. I'm able to adjust the projector setting. I'm using a sheet right now as a screen. Comes with a nice case for it too! Definitely a great purchase! Very pleased!
